Lab-02

Describing 5 Different Headless CMS and with Proof for 2 CMS by Implementing in the 11ty Project

Headless CMS Overview

Strapi

Overview: Strapi is an open-source headless CMS that's great for customization. It’s perfect for developers who like having control.

Key Features:

  • Flexible API creation

  • Supports multiple databases

  • Role-based access control

  • Plugin ecosystem

  • Media library

Key Benefits:

  • Customizable and flexible

  • Strong community support

  • Free and open-source

  • Developer-friendly

Contentful

Overview: Contentful is a cloud-based headless CMS. It helps you manage content separately from its delivery, making it easy to reuse across different platforms.

Key Features:

  • Flexible content modeling

  • REST and GraphQL APIs

  • Real-time updates with webhooks

  • Multi-language support

  • Integrations with many tools

Key Benefits:

  • User-friendly

  • Powerful APIs

  • Reliable and scalable

  • Great support and documentation

Sanity

Overview: Sanity is a real-time collaborative headless CMS. It offers powerful tools for content creation and teamwork.

Key Features:

  • Custom content schemas

  • Real-time collaboration

  • REST and GraphQL APIs

  • Portable content studio

  • Integrates with front-end frameworks

Key Benefits:

  • Real-time editing

  • Highly customizable

  • Strong community

  • Good performance and scalability

Prismic

Overview: Prismic is all about simplicity and ease of use. It helps both developers and content creators manage and deliver content efficiently.

Key Features:

  • Customizable content types

  • REST and GraphQL APIs

  • Content scheduling and versioning

  • Integration with modern frameworks

  • Rich text editor

Key Benefits:

  • Easy to use

  • Developer-friendly

  • Great for small to medium projects

  • Active support

Ghost

Overview: Ghost started as a blogging platform but now it's a strong headless CMS. It's known for its clean interface and focus on performance and SEO.

Key Features:

  • Content delivery via REST API

  • Built-in SEO tools

  • Membership and subscription features

  • Customizable themes

  • Integrates with third-party tools

Key Benefits:

  • User-friendly

  • Great for performance and SEO

  • Built-in membership features

  • Ideal for blogs and content-heavy sites

My Picks

Contentful

Why I Picked Contentful:

Contentful caught my eye because it's super flexible and easy to use. Here's why I like it:

  • User-Friendly: The interface is clean and easy to navigate, which is great for collaboration.

  • Flexible Content Models: It can create custom content structures that fit the exact needs.

  • Powerful APIs: Even though I don't need to integrate with other tools for my travel blog, it's nice to have the option available.

  • Real-Time Updates: Changes are reflected instantly, making content management efficient.

  • Multi-Language Support: Perfect for projects that need to reach a global audience.

  • Great User Experience: I found the site interface to be intuitive and user-friendly, making the whole experience enjoyable.

  • Engaging Platform: The platform is engaging and provides plenty of resources to help you learn and set up your project.

Overall, Contentful is reliable and versatile, making it ideal for managing complex content, and it was easy to set up for my 11ty travel blog project.

Proof of Implementation:

In eleventy.config.js file:

const contentful = require('contentful'); const client = contentful.createClient({ space: process.env.CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID, accessToken: process.env.CONTENTFUL_ACCESS_TOKEN, }); module.exports = function(eleventyConfig) { eleventyConfig.addCollection("contentfulPosts", async function() { const entries = await client.getEntries({ content_type: "blogPage" }); return entries.items.map(item => ({ title: item.fields.title, content: item.fields.content, image: item.fields.image ? item.fields.image.fields.file.url : null, slug: item.fields.title.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-'), })); }); };

Lab02: Describing 5 Different Headless CMS and with Proof for 2 CMS by Implementing in the 11ty Project

Headless CMS Overview

Strapi

Overview: Strapi is an open-source headless CMS that's great for customization. It’s perfect for developers who like having control.Key Features:

  • Flexible API creation

  • Supports multiple databases

  • Plugin ecosystem

  • Media library

Key Benefits:

  • Customizable and flexible

  • Strong community support

  • Free and open-source

  • Developer-friendly

Contentful

Overview: Contentful is a cloud-based headless CMS. It helps you manage content separately from its delivery, making it easy to reuse across different platforms.Key Features:

  • Flexible content modeling

  • REST and GraphQL APIs

  • Multi-language support

  • Integrations with many tools

Key Benefits:

  • User-friendly

  • Powerful APIs

  • Reliable and scalable

Sanity

Overview: Sanity is a real-time collaborative headless CMS. It offers powerful tools for content creation and teamwork.Key Features:

My Picks

Contentful

Why I Picked Contentful:Contentful caught my eye because it's super flexible and easy to use. Here's why I like it:

  • User-Friendly: The interface is clean and easy to navigate, which is great for collaboration.

  • Flexible Content Models: It can create custom content structures that fit the exact needs.

  • Powerful APIs: Even though I don't need to integrate with other tools for my travel blog, it's nice to have the option available.

  • Real-Time Updates: Changes are reflected instantly, making content management efficient.

  • Multi-Language Support: Perfect for projects that need to reach a global audience.

  • Great User Experience: I found the site interface to be intuitive and user-friendly, making the whole experience enjoyable.

  • Engaging Platform: The platform is engaging and provides plenty of resources to help you learn and set up your project.

Overall, Contentful is reliable and versatile, making it ideal for managing complex content, and it was easy to set up for my 11ty travel blog project.Proof of Implementation:In eleventy.config.js file:javascriptconst contentful = require('contentful'); const client = contentful.createClient({ space: process.env.CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID, accessToken: process.env.CONTENTFUL_ACCESS_TOKEN, }); module.exports = function(eleventyConfig) { eleventyConfig.addCollection("contentfulPosts", async function() { const entries = await client.getEntries({ content_type: "blogPage" }); return entries.items.map(item => ({ title: item.fields.title, content: item.fields.content, image: item.fields.image ? item.fields.image.fields.file.url : null, slug: item.fields.title.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-'), })); }); };

----------------------------------------------------

In blog.liquid file:

{% for post in posts %} <article> <h2><a href="/blog/{{ post.slug }}/">{{ post.title }}</a></h2> <p>{{ post.content | safe }}</p> <time datetime="{{ post.date }}">{{ post.date }}</time> </article> {% endfor %} -----------------------------------------------------

Contentful .env file:

CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID=MY_SPACE_ID CONTENTFUL_ACCESS_TOKEN=MY_ACCESS_TOKEN ------------------------------------------------------

Strapi

Why I Picked Strapi:

Strapi really impressed me with its flexibility and user-friendliness. Here’s why I chose it:

  • Easy to Use: Setting up Strapi and managing content is straightforward, thanks to the detailed explanations and resources available on their site.

  • Customizable Content Models: Just like Contentful, Strapi allows you to create custom content structures that fit your project's needs perfectly.

  • Powerful APIs: Even though I don't need to integrate with other tools for my travel blog, Strapi's REST and GraphQL APIs are robust and provide great options for future integration.

  • Great User Experience: The platform's interface is engaging and intuitive, making the setup process enjoyable and efficient.

  • Active Support and Community: Strapi has a helpful community and excellent support resources, ensuring you have guidance every step of the way.

  • Engaging Platform: The platform is engaging and comes with plenty of learning resources, which made it easy to set up for my project.

Strapi’s flexibility, ease of use, and comprehensive setup guides make it a fantastic choice for efficient content management. It was a breeze to set up for my 11ty travel blog, and the overall user experience has been excellent.

Proof of Implementation:

In eleventy.config.js file:

module.exports = function(eleventyConfig) { eleventyConfig.addCollection("blogPosts", async function() { const res = await axios.get("http://localhost:1337/api/pages"); return res.data; }); };

_______________________________________________________________

In blog.liquid file:

<div class="post-list"> {% for post in posts %} <div class="post-card"> <h2>{{ post.attributes.title }}</h2> {% if post.attributes.image %} <img src="{{ post.attributes.image.url }}" alt="{{ post.attributes.title }}" class="post-image"> {% endif %} <p>{{ post.attributes.content | truncatewords: 50 }}</p> <a href="/blog/{{ post.id }}" class="read-more-btn">Read More</a> </div> {% endfor %} </div>

____________________________________________________

In pagination.liquid file:

```<div class="post-list"> {% for post in posts %} <div class="post-card"> <h2>{{ post.attributes.title }}</h2> {% if post.attributes.image %} <img src="{{ post.attributes.image.url }}" alt="{{ post.attributes.title }}" class="post-image"> {% endif %} <p>{{ post.attributes.excerpt | truncatewords: 30 }}</p> <a href="/blog/{{ post.id }}" class="read-more-btn">Read More</a> </div> {% endfor %} </div>` _________________________________________________________

Strapi Content Manager:

Final Choice: Contentful

After experimenting with both Strapi and Contentful, I chose Contentful for my final product. Here’s why:

Why Contentful:

  • Ease of Setup: Contentful was super easy to set up with clear documentation and a user-friendly interface.

  • Intuitive Interface: Navigating through Contentful was straightforward, making content management a breeze.

  • Learning Resources: Plenty of tutorials and guides were available, making the learning process smooth.

  • Flexible Content Modeling: I could tailor the content structure to fit my travel blog perfectly.

  • Real-Time Updates: Changes were instantly reflected, which made managing content efficient.

Overall, Contentful stood out as the best option for my 11ty travel blog project due to its ease of use, intuitive interface, and robust features.
